answer:
**Frame‐by‐Frame Analysis**

1. **Frame 1 and 2:** The camera is looking down what appears to be a side street at night. No stop signage is immediately visible in these first two frames, though the street is fairly narrow and seems secondary (versus a main thoroughfare).

2. **Frame 3:** The intersection ahead begins to come into view. You can see cross‐traffic on a busier, well‐lit roadway; still no clear signposts on the far corners.

3. **Frame 4:** A large, octagonal STOP sign is now clearly visible on the right‐hand corner, facing the dashcam’s direction of travel. No corresponding stop sign is visible opposite it in this shot, nor are there stop signs on the cross street.

4. **Frame 5:** Again, the same STOP sign for the dashcam’s direction is plainly visible. There is no matching STOP sign across the intersection for oncoming traffic. Nor does the cross street appear to have stop signs; it has traffic signals farther down but no stop sign controlling the intersection itself.

**Contextual Reasoning**

• Because the only STOP sign visible is for the side street used by the dashcam (and presumably its opposing direction), while the cross street does not seem to have any stop signs, this suggests a two‐way stop condition applying to the dashcam’s street.  
• We do not see stop signs at all four corners (which would be a four‐way stop) and it is clear that at least one STOP sign is present (so it is not “No stop signs”).  
• It is also not a “two‐way stop for cross traffic” because the sign we do see is for the ego street, not for the main road.  

**Match to Answer Choices**

• A (Two way stop for ego) fits the evidence: the dashcam street is controlled by STOP signs, while the cross street does not appear to stop.  
• B (Two way stop for cross traffic) would require stop signs on the major road only, which we do not see.  
• C (Four way stop) is incorrect because we observe only one (or possibly two facing each other) STOP signs for the side street.  
• D (No stop signs present) is contradicted by the clearly visible STOP sign.  

<answer>A</answer>
